comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: He was an official in Near East Relief in the 20's, like some of the others in this 1927 series, a U.S. foreign aid program created in response to the Armenian Genocide: "Acheson, Rev. George Barclay D.D.: Leader in the Near East Relief movement and New Era Movement for the Presbyterian Church in the 1920's and 30's. Awarded the Greek Red Cross Medal (1927) & Order of the Phoenix of Greece (1930)." www.armenian-genocide.org/ner.html home.gwi.net/ages/Main Body/Noteworthy Kinsmen.html books.google.com/books?id=jvJMAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA157&d... Brother of Lila Bell Wallace, co-founder of Readers Digest. He was in New York on January 19, 1927 , to address the annual meeting of Near East Relief as its Director General of Overseas Operations. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10D11FF3E5B157A... The four honorees pictured in this collection: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/tags/neareastre...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: artolog: Thank you for the very detailed information on Rev. Acheson, complete with citations. This will be very helpful in expanding the description of this photo.
